word.name: woman

word.name: wonderfully

word.name: wood
word.definition: the hard, fibrous substance composing most of the stem and branches of a tree or shrub, and lying beneath the bark; the xylem.

word.name: wool
word.definition: the fine, soft, curly hair that forms the fleece of sheep and certain other animals, characterized by minute, overlapping surface scales that give it its felting property.

word.name: woo
word.definition: to seek the favor, affection, or love of, especially with a view to marriage.Synonyms

word.name: word
word.definition: a unit of language, consisting of one or more spoken sounds or their written representation, that functions as a principal carrier of meaning. Words are composed of one or more morphemes and are either the smallest units susceptible of independent use or consist of two or three such units combined under certain linking conditions, as with the loss of primary accent that distinguishes blackآirdנfrom blackנbird׮ Words are usually separated by spaces in writing, and are distinguished phonologically, as by accent, in many languages.

word.name: work
word.definition: exertion or effort directed to produce or accomplish something; labor; toil.

word.name: work
word.definition: exertion or effort directed to produce or accomplish something; labor; toil.

word.name: worm
word.definition: Zoology. any of numerous long, slender, soft-bodied, legless, bilaterally symmetrical invertebrates, including the flatworms, roundworms, acanthocephalans, nemerteans, gordiaceans, and annelids.

word.name: worriedly
word.definition: having or characterized by worry; concerned; anxious

word.definition: to torment oneself with or suffer from disturbing thoughts; fret.

word.name: worship
word.definition: reverent honor and homage paid to God or a sacred personage, or to any object regarded as sacred.

word.name: wound
word.definition: an injury, usually involving division of tissue or rupture of the integument or mucous membrane, due to external violence or some mechanical agency rather than disease.

word.name: wrack
word.definition: wreck or wreckage.

word.name: wrangle

word.name: wrap
word.definition: to enclose in something wound or folded about (often followed by up)

word.name: wreck

word.definition: to twist suddenly and forcibly; pull, jerk, or force by a violent twist

word.definition: to twist suddenly and forcibly; pull, jerk, or force by a violent twist

word.name: wren
word.definition: any of numerous small, active songbirds of the family Troglodytidae, especially Troglodytes troglodytes, of the Northern Hemisphere, having dark-brown plumage barred with black and a short, upright tail.

word.name: wrestle
word.definition: to engage in wrestling.

word.name: wrest
word.definition: to twist or turn; pull, jerk, or force by a violent twist.

word.name: wriggle
word.definition: to twist to and fro; writhe; squirm.

word.name: wring

word.name: wrinkle
word.definition: a small furrow or crease in the skin, especially of the face, as from aging or frowning.

word.name: wrist
word.definition: the carpus or lower part of the forearm where it joins the hand.

word.name: writer
word.definition: a person engaged in writing books, articles, stories, etc., especially as an occupation or profession; an author or journalist.

word.name: write
word.definition: to trace or form (characters, letters, words, etc.) on the surface of some material, as with a pen, pencil, or other instrument or means; inscribe

word.name: writhe
word.definition: to twist the body about, or squirm, as in pain, violent effort, etc.

word.name: writing
word.definition: the act of a person or thing that writes.

word.name: yawningly
word.definition: being or standing wide open; gaping

word.name: yearly
word.definition: pertaining to a year or to each year.

word.name: yesterday

word.name: yieldingly
